paper_abstract: Many efficient string matching algorithms make use of q-grams and process the text in windows which are read backward. In this paper we provide a framework for analyzing the average case complexity of these algorithms taking into account the statistical dependencies between overlapping q-grams. We apply this to the q-gram Boyer-Moore-Horspool algorithm adapted to various string matching problems and show that the algorithm is optimal on average. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Average complexity of backward q-gram string matching algorithms
